Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a TCP client class in Java that handles network communication with a server, including connection management, data transmission, and reception with proper error handling and resource management.

Class Description: The TcpClient class establishes and maintains a TCP connection to a specified server, sends data packets, and receives responses. It uses a custom protocol with 8-byte headers (4 bytes for type, 4 bytes for length) followed by the message body. The class runs network operations on a dedicated background thread and provides callback mechanisms for received data.

Attributes:
- TAG: String - Tag for logging purposes
- PACKAGE_HEAD_LENGTH: int - Fixed length of packet header (8 bytes)
- receiveListener: ReceiveListener - Callback interface for received data
- hostip: String - Server IP address to connect to
- port: int - Server port number
- socketClient: Socket - The TCP socket instance
- handler: Handler - Handler for background thread operations
- receiveThread: Thread - Thread for receiving data

Methods:
- TcpClient() -> void - Constructor that initializes the background thread and attempts connection
- tryConnect() -> void - Internal method to attempt server connection in a loop
- connect() -> boolean - Establishes socket connection to server (returns success status)
- send(byte[] data) -> void - Sends data to the server (runs on background thread)
- onReceive(ReceiveListener receiveListener) -> void - Sets the receive callback listener
- destroy() -> void - Cleans up resources and stops all network operations
- closeAll() -> void - Safely closes socket and releases resources
- startReceive() -> void - Starts the data receiving thread
- getLengthFromHeadByte(byte[] b) -> int - Extracts message length from header bytes
- getTypeFromHeadByte(byte[] b) -> int - Extracts message type from header bytes

Nested Classes:
- Receiver implements Runnable - Background thread implementation for continuous data reception
